intro: Elaeochytris cachroides, commonly known as the golden ghost sponge, is a unique marine organism that belongs to the phylum Chromista. It is characterized by its intricate, branching structure composed of a gelatinous matrix containing numerous pores. This organism thrives in shallow, warm coastal waters and is often found attached to rocky substrates. Elaeochytris cachroides plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to nutrient cycling. Its distinctive appearance and ecological significance make it an interesting subject for marine biological studies.
